title: First Transatlantic Telegraph Cable
overview: The first transatlantic telegraph cable is laid between Ireland and Newfoundland. Though it operated only briefly, it marked the beginning of global subsea communication.

title: TAT-1 — First Transatlantic Telephone Cable
overview: The TAT-1 system enters service, providing 36 telephone circuits between the United Kingdom and Canada. It marks the dawn of subsea voice communication.

title: TAT-8 — First Fiber-Optic Transatlantic Cable
overview: TAT-8, the first transatlantic fiber-optic cable, is deployed with a capacity of 280 Mb/s. It represents a massive leap in subsea data transmission.

title: FLAG — Fiber-Optic Link Around the Globe
overview: FLAG becomes one of the longest submarine cables ever built, linking Europe, the Middle East, Asia, and beyond in a single global infrastructure.

title: SEA-ME-WE 3
overview: The South-East Asia–Middle East–Western Europe 3 (SEA-ME-WE 3) cable goes live, spanning 39,000 km — at the time the world's longest submarine cable system.

title: SEA-ME-WE 4
overview: SEA-ME-WE 4 is deployed, providing 1.28 Tb/s capacity across 18 countries from France to Singapore, enhancing connectivity in Europe, Middle East, and Asia.

title: SEA-ME-WE 5 Announced
overview: Work begins on SEA-ME-WE 5, designed to provide 24 Tb/s capacity over 20,000 km, reinforcing one of the busiest subsea corridors on Earth.

title: FASTER — Trans-Pacific Cable
overview: The FASTER cable system, backed by Google and partners, comes online between the US and Japan with a design capacity of 60 Tb/s.

title: MAREA — Microsoft & Facebook
overview: The MAREA cable, a joint project by Microsoft, Facebook, and Telxius, goes live across the Atlantic with 200 Tb/s design capacity.

title: 2Africa Cable Project
overview: The 2Africa submarine cable, led by a consortium including Meta, is launched to encircle Africa, designed for up to 180 Tb/s capacity.

title: Apricot Cable Announced
overview: Apricot, a subsea cable system connecting Japan, Taiwan, Guam, the Philippines, Indonesia, and Singapore, is announced by Google and regional partners.

title: Blue & Raman Systems Progress
overview: The Blue (Mediterranean) and Raman (India) cables, led by Google, advance construction, reshaping connectivity between Europe, the Middle East, and Asia.
